item.title: 富国银行首席执行官对监管修复表示更有信心
item.description: 富国银行首席执行官查理-沙尔夫（Charlie Scharf）周三表示，在长达数年的假账户丑闻之后，他对该行在解决合规问题方面取得的进展更有信心，并详细介绍了该行在实施风险控制方面所做的努力。【原文：Wells Fargo CEO Charlie Scharf expressed more confidence on Wednesday in the bank's progress to fix compliance problems after its years-long fake accounts scandal, detailing its efforts to implement risk controls.】

item.title: 聚焦：消息人士称，联合信贷银行的 Orcel 在 Banco BPM 被迫出手之前就在谋划竞购事宜
item.description: 两位与此事关系密切的消息人士称，联合信贷银行首席执行官 Andrea Orcel 多年来一直在制定收购 Banco BPM 的计划，并几乎准备好扣动扳机。【原文：UniCredit CEO Andrea Orcel has been drawing up plans to take over Banco BPM for years and was almost ready to pull the trigger, two sources close to the matter said.】

item.title: TechInsights 称，华为新款 Mate 70 手机芯片并未进行重大重新设计
item.description: 咨询公司 TechInsights 周三表示，华为新款 Mate 70 智能手机所采用的芯片设计与上一代产品相比仅有 "渐进式改进"，而且与一些预期相反，该芯片采用的是 7 纳米（nm）工艺节点。【原文：Huawei's new Mate 70 smartphone contains a chip whose design shows only an "incremental improvement" over its predecessor and, contrary to some expectations, was made using the 7 nanometer (nm) process node, consultancy TechInsights said on Wednesday.】

item.title: VIEW 11月美国CPI涨幅与上月持平，为12月宽松敞开大门
item.description: 11 月份美国消费者物价增幅为七个月来最大，但在劳动力市场降温的背景下，这不太可能阻止美联储下周第三次降息。【原文：U.S. consumer prices increased by the most in seven months in November, but that is unlikely to discourage the Federal Reserve from cutting interest rates for a third time next week against the backdrop of a cooling labor market.】

item.title: Albertsons 在终止兼并竞标后向竞争对手 Kroger 索要数十亿美元
item.description: Albertsons 周三终止了其 250 亿美元与 Kroger 合并的竞标，因为法院阻止了这一交易，Albertsons 还起诉其竞争对手，称其违约导致交易失败。【原文：Albertsons on Wednesday terminated its $25 billion bid to merge with Kroger after courts blocked the deal and sued its rival, alleging a breach of contract that led to the deal's demise.】

item.title: 美国 11 月居民消费价格创七个月来最大涨幅
item.description: 11 月份美国消费者物价增幅为七个月来最大，但在劳动力市场降温的背景下，这不太可能阻止美联储下周第三次降息。【原文：U.S. consumer prices increased by the most in seven months in November, but that is unlikely to discourage the Federal Reserve from cutting interest rates for a third time next week against the backdrop of a cooling labor market.】

item.title: 通用汽车退出 Cruise 将焦点转向扩大机器人轴的挑战
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）决定终止陷入困境的 Cruise 机器人出租车业务，这凸显了仍在竞争中的其他公司所面临的残酷现实：完善技术需要长期的承诺，也需要雄厚的资金。【原文：General Motors' decision to pull the plug on its troubled Cruise robotaxi business highlights the harsh reality facing others still in the race: it requires a long-term commitment to perfect the technology and deep pockets to fund it.】

item.title: 蒙迪艾尔称，在与好时进行交易谈判的报道中，将重点关注附加交易
item.description: 吉百利（Cadbury）的所有者蒙代尔兹公司（Mondelez）周三表示，在宣布一项高达 90 亿美元的股票回购计划时，该公司将把重点放在 "附加 "交易上。【原文：Cadbury-owner Mondelez said on Wednesday it would focus on "bolt-on" deals as it announced an up to $9 billion share buyback program.】

item.title: 关税威胁迫在眉睫，外资流入新兴市场的现金将减少 - IIF
item.description: 一家银行业贸易组织周三表示，随着美国新任总统唐纳德-特朗普承诺的政策在全球市场产生影响，2025年全球经济增长将放缓，海外投资者将把流向新兴市场的现金减少近四分之一。【原文：Global growth will slow in 2025, and offshore investors are set to cut the cash they send to emerging markets by nearly a quarter, as promised policies from incoming U.S. President Donald Trump reverberate through global markets, a banking trade group said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 分析师称，随着交易即将终止，克罗格和阿尔伯森可能转向广告业务
item.description: 分析师说，在联邦法院阻止了克罗格（Kroger）与阿尔伯森（Albertsons）价值 250 亿美元的合并案后，这两家超市竞争对手可能会转向快速增长且利润丰厚的广告企业，以应对竞争并实现增长。【原文：After a federal court blocked the $25 billion Kroger -Albertsons merger, the two supermarket rivals could turn to fast-growing and profitable advertising ventures to tackle competition and grow, analysts said.】

item.title: 苹果在最新的 iOS 更新中为 iPhone 添加了 ChatGPT
item.description: 苹果公司周三开始将 OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 集成到其设备中，实现了投资者期待已久的功能，希望这将有助于推动其最新款 iPhone 的销售。【原文：Apple on Wednesday started integrating OpenAI's ChatGPT into its devices, delivering on a long-awaited feature that investors hope will help drive sales of its latest iPhones.】

item.title: 欧佩克再次下调 2024 年和 2025 年石油需求增长预测
item.description: 欧佩克周三下调了对2024年和2025年全球石油需求增长的预测，这是欧佩克连续第五次下调该产油国集团的月度报告。【原文：OPEC lowered its forecasts for 2024 and 2025 global oil demand growth on Wednesday in the fifth consecutive cut to the producers group's monthly report.】

item.title: 大都会人寿与通用大西洋公司将成立再保险合资企业
item.description: MetLife 和 General Atlantic 的高管周三告诉路透社，两家公司正在组建一家再保险合资企业，这是保险公司与另类资金管理公司联手提高低风险保险资产收益这一日益增长的趋势中的最新举措。【原文：MetLife and General Atlantic are forming a reinsurance venture, the companies' executives told Reuters on Wednesday, the latest in a growing trend of insurers and alternative money managers teaming up to boost returns from low-risk insurance assets.】

item.title: 梅西百货下调年度利润预期，原因是需求疲软导致大幅打折
item.description: 梅西百货公司（Macy's M.N）周三下调了年度利润预期，股价下跌 8%，原因是其同名商店的销售疲软，迫使其在假日季加大促销力度。【原文：Macy's M.N on Wednesday cut its annual profit forecast, sending shares down 8%, as weak sales at its eponymous stores have forced it to lean on increased promotions during the holiday season.】

item.title: Krispy Kreme 称网络安全事件影响了美国的在线订单
item.description: 甜甜圈连锁店 Krispy Kreme 周三表示，其部分信息技术系统受到未经授权的活动干扰，包括美国的在线订购。【原文：Doughnut chain Krispy Kreme said on Wednesday that unauthorized activity on a portion of its information technology systems has disrupted certain operations, including online ordering in the United States.】

item.title: 未来流行病可能造成 13.6 万亿美元的经济损失 - 伦敦劳合社
item.description: 据商业保险市场伦敦劳合社预测，另一次人类大流行病可能在五年内给全球经济造成 13.6 万亿美元的经济损失。【原文：Another human pandemic could cause economic losses of $13.6 trillion for the global economy over a five-year period, commercial insurance market Lloyd's of London predicted.】

item.title: 聚焦：2024 年收购狂潮之后，贝莱德对私募市场的推动可能仍未结束
item.description: 2024 年，贝莱德的交易热潮可能会继续，因为这家全球最大的资产管理公司预计会伺机在私人信贷、房地产、基础设施或私募股权领域进一步扩张。【原文：A dealmaking splurge by BlackRock in 2024 may continue as the world's largest asset manager is expected to opportunistically look to further expand in private credit, real estate, infrastructure or possibly private equity.】

item.title: 在关键的通胀数据公布前，期货价格持稳
item.description: 美国股指期货周三呈区间震荡走势，原因是投资者在当天晚些时候公布可能影响美联储本月政策决定的关键性通胀数据之前保持观望。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were range-bound on Wednesday as investors stayed on the sidelines ahead of a pivotal inflation reading due later in the day that could influence the Federal Reserve's policy decision this month.】

item.title: 加拿大央行可能将利率下调 50 个基点
item.description: 经济学家和分析师表示，加拿大央行准备在周三将其关键政策利率再下调 50 个基点，因为疲软的失业数字和低迷的经济增长凸显出经济需要支持。【原文：The Bank of Canada is poised to cut its key policy rate by another 50 basis points on Wednesday as weak unemployment numbers and poor growth underscore an economy that needs support, economists and analysts said.】

item.title: 独家报道特朗普关税计划使帝亚吉欧和贝克龙舌兰酒的 30 亿美元进口面临风险
item.description: 根据路透社查阅的墨西哥海关数据，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普计划对墨西哥征收的关税，可能会对龙舌兰酒和梅斯卡尔酒的进口造成约 30 亿美元的风险，这些进口商包括顶级烈酒制造商帝亚吉欧（Diageo）和何塞-库尔沃（Jose Cuervo）的所有者贝克尔（Becle）。【原文：Some $3 billion in tequila and mezcal imports from top makers of the popular spirits, Diageo and Jose Cuervo owner Becle, are at risk from U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's planned tariffs on Mexico, according to Mexican customs data reviewed by Reuters.】

item.title: 人民币走软引发外汇市场竞相抄底的幽灵
item.description: 分析人士说，中国高层讨论明年允许本国货币走软的问题，凸显了投资者和企业面临的风险，即随着美国关税改变全球贸易和资金流向，大的外汇举措即将到来。【原文：High-level discussions in China about allowing its currency to weaken next year underscore the risk for investors and companies that big foreign exchange moves are coming as U.S. tariffs shift global trade and money flows, analysts said.】

item.title: 中国的人民币计划与通胀展望
item.description: 阿曼达-库珀（Amanda Cooper）对美国和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by Amanda Cooper.】

item.title: 阿卡迪亚公司与多家公司着眼于在美国推出价值 90 亿美元的可再生能源产品
item.description: 项目负责人告诉路透社，美国投资者阿卡迪亚基础设施资本公司（Acadia Infrastructure Capital）和包括微软在内的公司正寻求帮助在全国范围内开发价值 90 亿美元的可再生能源项目管道。【原文：U.S. investor Acadia Infrastructure Capital and companies including Microsoft are looking to help develop a $9 billion pipeline of renewable energy projects across the country, the project lead told Reuters.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯-奔驰改组管理委员会
item.description: 德国汽车制造商梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）周三表示，将对其管理委员会进行改组，新增四名成员，改组将于 2025 年生效。【原文：German carmaker Mercedes-Benz will reshuffle its management board with four new members, the firm said on Wednesday, with changes due to take effect in 2025.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行已做好准备，一旦美国加征关税冲击全球贸易，将做出强烈反应
item.description: 澳大利亚央行一位高级官员周三表示，如果美国可能征收的关税打击全球贸易并威胁到国内经济增长，澳大利亚央行已准备好 "强力 "应对。【原文：Australia's central bank is ready to respond "with force" should potential U.S. tariffs hit global trade and threaten growth at home, a top official said on Wednesday, a day after it surprised markets by opening the door to an easing.】

item.title: 日本汽车工会组织 7 年来首次重提涨薪目标
item.description: 日本主要汽车制造商的工会组织周三表示，在明年的年度春季工资谈判中，工会将寻求每月加薪 12,000 日元（79.15 美元）或更多。【原文：Labour unions at major Japanese auto manufacturers will seek monthly pay hikes of 12,000 yen ($79.15) or more in annual spring wage negotiations next year, the unions' group said on Wednesday.】

item.title: Preqin 称，新对冲基金发行量将创 24 年新低
item.description: 对冲基金研究公司 Preqin 周三表示，根据今年前三季度的数据，在艰难的筹资条件下，新对冲基金的发行量 "很可能 "在年底达到 24 年来的最低点。【原文：New hedge fund launches will 'likely' end the year at their lowest in 24 years amid tough fundraising conditions, hedge fund research firm Preqin said on Wednesday, based on numbers from the first three quarters of this year.】

item.title: 幸运星制造商 BAT 下半年新产品类别可燃物收入增长强劲
item.description: 英美烟草公司周三预测，在美国投资增加的推动下，下半年其新品类（包括吸食器和口服尼古丁产品）和可燃烟的收入将出现更强劲的增长。【原文：British American Tobacco on Wednesday forecast stronger revenue growth in its new category, which includes vapes and oral nicotine products, and combustibles in the second half of the year, driven by increased investments in the United States.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，随着特朗普贸易风险的逼近，中国政府正在考虑削弱人民币汇率
item.description: 中国最高领导人和政策制定者正在考虑允许人民币在 2025 年走弱，因为他们要为唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）再次担任总统后美国提高贸易关税做好准备。【原文：China's top leaders and policymakers are considering allowing the yuan to weaken in 2025 as they brace for higher U.S. trade tariffs in a second Donald Trump presidency.】

item.title: Zara 所有者 Inditex 公布的第三季度销售额令人失望
item.description: 周三，Zara 的所有者 Inditex 公布了罕见的第三季度销售业绩不佳，但这家全球最大的上市快速时尚零售商表示，假日购物季已经有了一个良好的开端。【原文：Zara owner Inditex posted a rare miss on third-quarter sales on Wednesday but the world's biggest listed fast-fashion retailer said the holiday shopping season had got off to a good start.】
